sentences.english: Milton compares it to the mast of a ship.
sentences.chinese: 彌爾頓把它比作船上的桅杆。

sentences.english: I have a call from Kon Tou Tak yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 我昨天從桅杆頭德有一次呼叫。

sentences.english: On a mainsail, the luff attaches to the mast.
sentences.chinese: 在一面主帆上，帆前緣被連接到桅杆上。

sentences.english: The Type 037-I can be distinguished by its bulky radome positioned on the bridge roof ahead of the tripod mast.
sentences.chinese: 型以它位於艦橋頂部三腳桅杆上的龐大天線罩爲特點。

sentences.english: A spar rising aft from a mast to support the head of a quadrilateral fore-and-aft sail.
sentences.chinese: 從船尾桅杆伸出支撐船頭四方形的船帆的圓材。

sentences.english: The rig is one mast and two sails.
sentences.chinese: 這種船上有一根桅杆和兩面帆。

sentences.english: Heavy Lift Mast Crane, Floating Sheerleg, Offshore Crane.
sentences.chinese: 大型桅杆吊，浮吊，海洋工程吊。

sentences.english: But now I find that every man before the mast knows more than I do.
sentences.chinese: 但是現在我發現桅杆前的每個人知道的都比我多。

sentences.english: After the white-gray sails taut to their spars and ropes.
sentences.chinese: 灰繩拉緊白帆袖桅杆向天愁。

sentences.english: I stood on the barriers in the Kippax and held my dad's neck.
sentences.chinese: 我站在桅杆外面，抱着我爸的脖子。

sentences.english: The tide washed in some broken spars.
sentences.chinese: 潮水衝來幾根折斷的桅杆。

sentences.english: He unstepped the mast and furled the sail and tied it.
sentences.chinese: 他拔下桅杆，把帆捲起，繫住。

sentences.english: They have a small sailboat with a 14-foot mast.
sentences.chinese: 他們的小帆船桅杆是14英尺。

sentences.english: Clasping to the masts, he endured a sea that almost split the deck.
sentences.chinese: 他抓緊桅杆，頂着一陣差點兒把甲板衝成兩半的海浪。

sentences.english: Probably was so masted when she set forth.
sentences.chinese: 在她啓程時，大概桅杆直立，帆完全扯起。

sentences.english: The lower aft corner of a fore-and-aft sail.
sentences.chinese: 從船尾桅杆伸出支撐船頭四方形的船帆的圓材。

definition: sides of a ship/ship's railing/fig. the dividing line between shipboard expenses and onshore freight charges
the bow or prow of a ship
